vignette.name: Configuring Standalone Options
vignette.bodytext: To configure options for your standalone application, you place a standalone object in your toplevel patcher. Then you use the Inspector on the object to choose various options about how you want your application to behave. When the standalone application is built, the options you set in the standalone are saved.
The standalone object reference page has detailed information on each of the object's attributes that configure runtime standalone behavior.
